citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Satellite Data - SeaWIFS, 1997-present

descript.abstract: Satellite Imagery from September, 1997 to present; North America Pacific Coast from Baja California to the arctic.
descript.purpose: Detection of phytoplankton blooms, biomass in the ocean.
descript.supplinf: Risk Justification: Data not secured in regional data centre. Data could be replaced but would require time and effort. Risk of Loss: Medium Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific, government or public community within the last 5 years. Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: Back up the CD collection, or, provide secured storage.

place.placekey: North Inner Coast (QCS, Hecate, Dixon Inlet and passages)
South Inner Coast (Johnstone, Georgia, JDF, inlets and passages)

idinfo.useconst: Data are under a non-disclosure licence with SeaWIFS.

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road
Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: John Wallace, IOS, Rm 2217 Hardcopy Description: "Quick look" satellite images, printed on paper and stored in binders. Hardcopy Volume: About 20 3 in. binders (SeaWIFS and NOAA images, combined volume)
stdorder.ordering: A search program on the Internet allows users to search the data: http://www.pac.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/sci/osap/data/searchtools/SearchSatellites2.asp Otherwise, contact data custodian.

digtinfo.formcont: Program supplied free of charge by NASA.

stdorder.ordering: Electronic Data Doc Locations: see NOAA Dataset Locations: IOS Rm 2217. NOTE: no backups exist for data set; no particular fire protection measures in data storage room.

distinfo.techpreq: Backup by Custodian: N Backup by Automation: N Backup Description: Not feasible to back up the data at present (it would take at least 5 weeks to do so).
